intro: Bupleurum cappadocicum, commonly known as Cappadocian angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and appear in late spring to early summer. Bupleurum cappadocicum is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
